source:
import re
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import requests
import geopandas as gpd

source:
#Read-in pre-prepared csv as pandas df
camena = pd.read_csv('camena_notext.csv',encoding='ISO-8859-1').dropna().reset_index()

# will return to encoding errors in '1' column
camena
camena['2'] = camena['2'].apply(lambda x: int(re.search('(\d+)',x).group(0)) if re.search('(\d+)',x) else np.nan)

time_df = pd.DataFrame(camena['2'].value_counts()).reset_index().rename(columns={'index':'year', '2':'freq'})

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(20, 10))
ax.bar(list(time_df['year']),list(time_df['freq']))
ax.set_title("Camena text frequency over time")
ax.set_ylabel("Frequency")
ax.set_xlabel("Year")
fig.autofmt_xdate()

plt.show()
Here, we plotted the frequency of text production over time.

camena['1'] = camena['1'].apply(lambda x: x.split(';') if ';' in x else x.split(',') if ',' in x else x.split('/') if '/' in x else x)
camena = camena.explode('1')
# fixing encoding error from above
camena['1'] = camena['1'].apply(lambda x: x.encode('ISO-8859-1').decode('utf-8'))

##Query GeoNames
pn_df = pd.DataFrame(camena['1'].value_counts()).reset_index().rename(columns={'index':'placename','1':'counts'})
pn_df['geonames_xml'] = pn_df['placename'].apply(lambda x: BeautifulSoup(requests.get(f'http://api.geonames.org/search?name_equals={x}&continentCode=EU&maxRows=10&username=pnadel').text).find('geoname'))
pn_df['lat'] = pn_df['geonames_xml'].apply(lambda x: float(x.find('lat').get_text()) if x != None else '')
pn_df['lng'] = pn_df['geonames_xml'].apply(lambda x: float(x.find('lng').get_text()) if x != None else '')
pn_df = pn_df[['placename','lat','lng','counts']]

## Latin version of German names does not come up in GeoNames. We drop them here, but mroe solutions should be considered.
pn_drop = pn_df.drop(pn_df.loc[pn_df['lat'] == ''].index)
pn_drop = pn_drop.sort_values('counts')

# Read-in geojson for plotting
filename = "europe.geojson"
file = open(filename)
df = gpd.read_file(file)


fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(16,12))
## select countries to plot
df[df['id'] == 'FR'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'DE'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'GB'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'PL'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'CH'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'IT'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'BE'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'NL'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'AT'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'LU'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'DK'].plot(ax=ax)
df[df['id'] == 'CZ'].plot(ax=ax)
pn_drop.plot(x="lng",y='lat',kind='scatter',c='counts', colormap="YlOrRd",ax=ax)
ax.grid(b=True, alpha=0.5)
plt.show()
Here, we plotted the frequency of text production in space.
